Albert Einstein - Because he was a brilliant physicist who changed the way we think about the universe. He could provide valuable insights into modern physics and help us solve some of our biggest challenges.

Mahatma Gandhi - Because he was a powerful advocate for non-violent social change and his teachings still resonate today. He could inspire people around the world to stand up for what they believe in and work towards a more just society.

Leonardo da Vinci - Because he was a polymath who made groundbreaking contributions to art, science, and engineering. He could share his incredible creativity and knowledge with us, helping us push the boundaries of human achievement.

Frida Kahlo - Because she was a talented artist who used her paintings to express her innermost thoughts and emotions. She could provide inspiration for artists everywhere and help us better understand the human experience.

Marie Curie - Because she was a pioneering scientist who made significant contributions to the field of radioactivity. She could share her knowledge and expertise with us, helping us unlock new discoveries and advancements in medicine and technology.
